fullForm: National Institute of Design Design Aptitude Test
mode: Studio Test and Interview for Mains
eligibility: For B.Des: Candidates must have completed 10+2. For M.Des: Candidates must have a bachelor's degree.[3]
duration: Prelims: 3 hours (180 minutes) for B.Des; 2.5 hours (150 minutes) for M.Des[1][4]

faqs.question: What is the structure of the NID DAT exam?
faqs.answer: NID DAT is conducted in two stages: Prelims (a written exam with objective and subjective questions) and Mains (Studio Test and Personal Interview) for shortlisted candidates.[3][4]
